citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The facility has a visiting veterinarian for their animals and also a written program of veterinary care (PVC) for dogs,
however the written PVC that covers the care of the goats, pigs, and deer could not be located during the inspection. A
written PVC that covers each regulated species at the facility is required to be available for APHIS officials to help ensure
that veterinary care from an attending veterinarian is available. Ensure to locate or work with the attending veterinarian on
updating the program of veterinary care so that it covers the care of the goats, pigs, and deer.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class C license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by September 18, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The facility has a visiting veterinarian for their animals and also a written program of veterinary care (PVC) for dogs, 
however the written PVC that covers the care of the goats, pigs, and deer could not be located during the inspection. A 
written PVC that covers each regulated species at the facility is required to be available for APHIS officials to help ensure 
that veterinary care from an attending veterinarian is available. Ensure to locate or work with the attending veterinarian on 
updating the program of veterinary care so that it covers the care of the goats, pigs, and deer. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class C license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by September 18, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
